comments.author: thompson.clifford@gmail.com
comments.creator: thompson.clifford@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X Mach-O; en-US; rv:1.8b5) Gecko/20051006 Firefox/1.4.1
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; U; PPC Mac OS X Mach-O; en-US; rv:1.8b5) Gecko/20051006 Firefox/1.4.1

After I open Firefox I go and click on the Bookmarks Menu and it displays properly, but upon clicking a link it won't load the website. The Bookmarks Menu will disappear like it is supposed to after click on a link, but the website won't load and the url isn't displayed in the address bar.


P.S. I would like to note that the defect is most likely related with the menu it self. It likely isn't pointing to the links correctly. I've come to this conclusion, because I'm using the extension All-In-One Sidebar and with it I go to the Bookmarks section and I am able to load a website from there.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open Firefox
2. Click on the menu titled "Bookmarks"
3. Click on any link

Actual Results:  
Bookmarks Menu disappears, but the website doesn't load and the url isn't displayed in the address bar.

Expected Results:  
Bookmarks Menu disappears and the website loads and the url is displayed in the address bar.

I don't know if this is relavent, but I'll give the build configuration just incase.



about:buildconfig

Build platform
target
powerpc-apple-darwin7.9.0

Build tools

cc 	gcc version 3.3 20030304 (Apple Computer, Inc. build 1666) 	-Wall -W -Wno-unused -Wpointer-arith -Wcast-align -Wno-long-long -nostdinc -isystem /Developer/SDKs/MacOSX10.2.8.sdk/usr/include/gcc/darwin/3.3 -isystem /Developer/SDKs/MacOSX10.2.8.sdk/usr/include -F/Developer/SDKs/MacOSX10.2.8.sdk/System/Library/Frameworks -fpascal-strings -no-cpp-precomp -fno-common -I/Developer/SDKs/MacOSX10.2.8.sdk/Developer/Headers/FlatCarbon -pipe

comments.creator: philringnalda@gmail.com
comments.raw_text: The most relevant thing would be the mention of an extension, actually. Please start Firefox in safe mode (http://kb.mozillazine.org/Safe_mode), and if it then works with your extensions disabled, you can disable them one by one in normal mode until you find the broken one, so you can let the extension author know.
comments.text: The most relevant thing would be the mention of an extension, actually. Please start Firefox in safe mode (http://kb.mozillazine.org/Safe_mode), and if it then works with your extensions disabled, you can disable them one by one in normal mode until you find the broken one, so you can let the extension author know.
comments.author: philringnalda@gmail.com

comments.creator: thompson.clifford@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
Thanks for the input. I did what you said and found that the plugin NoScript is the culprit. It didn't cross my mind that this would be the problem, but after I disabled all my bookmark extensions I use and found that it still wasn't working...I remembered that there was no text in the menu for NoScript. I even tried the latest version (1.1.3.4) of NoScript and it gave the same results. For the time being it seems (at least for Mac) that NoScript can't be used until the author updates. I'll point the author to this report.

P.S. In the future I'll try the method that you told me to do (the safe mode, ect). I'm...just surprised that something so unrelated to the bookmarks is the one that caused the problem.
comments.text:

P.S. In the future I'll try the method that you told me to do (the safe mode, ect). I'm...just surprised that something so unrelated to the bookmarks is the one that caused the problem.

comments.raw_text: Everything's pretty interdependent, what with it all being JavaScript sitting in the same scope, like one big dysfunctional family crammed into a too-small room ;)
comments.text: Everything's pretty interdependent, what with it all being JavaScript sitting in the same scope, like one big dysfunctional family crammed into a too-small room ;)

comments.author: thompson.clifford@gmail.com
comments.text:
As requested (during e-mail chat),

In reply to the e-mail with the NoScript author (or team member, sorry didn't look that far into detail because the website is kind of cluttery to me),
"First off, they are regular bookmarks.
Second off, I thought I'd try the DeerPark version and see if it would work, but after I installed it I was lazy and went back to the 1.5 version to do what you said. I don't know if my computer or firefox is being special today or if it is because I installed DeerPark and then ran 1.5 afterwards, but now after I installed NoScript it is displaying the menus correctly as well as letting me use my bookmarks. This is really odd. I wonder if it is an on and off thing (depending on how it feels when firefox loads up (heh))... I'll e-mail you again if I find any troubles. I will say that when I installed the extension (before I closed firefox) it said something was wrong with line 2. I can get it if you really want me to, but it said something about using document instead (I think it was document.** ...I can't remember what it was where the ** is...)."

Then Giorgio replied to what I posted below:
"'it said something was wrong with line 2. I can get it if you really want me to, but it said something about using document instead (I think it was document.** ...I can't remember what it was where the ** is...).'

Maybe something about document.getSelection() being deprecate in favor of window.getSelection()?
If so, this doesn't come from NoScript - probably from another extension - but it's a warning rather than a real error."


P.S. I hope this is satusfactory enough...I'm about to go to bed and checked my e-mail and felt that I should fulfill the request. Hope this helps a little, good night.
comments.raw_text:
As requested (during e-mail chat),

In reply to the e-mail with the NoScript author (or team member, sorry didn't look that far into detail because the website is kind of cluttery to me),
"First off, they are regular bookmarks.
Second off, I thought I'd try the DeerPark version and see if it would work, but after I installed it I was lazy and went back to the 1.5 version to do what you said. I don't know if my computer or firefox is being special today or if it is because I installed DeerPark and then ran 1.5 afterwards, but now after I installed NoScript it is displaying the menus correctly as well as letting me use my bookmarks. This is really odd. I wonder if it is an on and off thing (depending on how it feels when firefox loads up (heh))... I'll e-mail you again if I find any troubles. I will say that when I installed the extension (before I closed firefox) it said something was wrong with line 2. I can get it if you really want me to, but it said something about using document instead (I think it was document.** ...I can't remember what it was where the ** is...)."

Then Giorgio replied to what I posted below:
"'it said something was wrong with line 2. I can get it if you really want me to, but it said something about using document instead (I think it was document.** ...I can't remember what it was where the ** is...).'

Maybe something about document.getSelection() being deprecate in favor of window.getSelection()?
If so, this doesn't come from NoScript - probably from another extension - but it's a warning rather than a real error."


P.S. I hope this is satusfactory enough...I'm about to go to bed and checked my e-mail and felt that I should fulfill the request. Hope this helps a little, good night.
comments.creator: thompson.clifford@gmail.com
